fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11055].
  {panel}

From the space admin interface, when granting permissions to an LDAP group with the help of magnifying glass button, a new window pops up, allowing to do a search to retrieve the group to be granted.
This window contains the form to do the actual search and a paginated list of all existing groups.
To create and display this list, Confluence run a full LDAP request (cn=*) before we choose the search pattern (have a look in the attachment, request #1). This 1st request is potentially heavy. Is it possible to avoid it by simply removing the initial display of the groups list? Just keep the search box at the init, and then display the resultset retrieved by the currently second request (have a look in the attachment, request #2). 

Thank you,
Ludovic
fields.summary: Remove a poorly usefull LDAP request in Space Permissions Administration interface.
Spaces (List) Macro - The ability to set a default Space tab

fields.description:
The "Known Issues" documentation is really about configuration of particular application servers, not so much bugs or known issues.

It looks bad when we have "Known Issues" pages for all our supported application servers. Without looking at the pages, you would think there were many problems with them.

Example: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+Apache+Tomcat
fields.summary: Rename "Known Issues ..." documents to "... Configuration Guide"

fields.description:
The confluence API should prevent plugins from attaching files to a history version of pages. EditGrid and potentially Gliffy did this by accident causing some major security concerns on the hosted instance by exposing attachment filenames via the index. 

An exception should be thrown to prevent users from attaching files to historical content.
fields.summary: Adding attachment to a history version of a page causes data corruption and issues with security

fields.description:
There is a good chance that the calendar plugin breaks on recent versions of Confluence, so as a precaution until we're able to do proper testing, I would like us to warn users on the extensions page at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Calendar+Plugin

I've logged a testing request at http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CAL-241 that links to the bug I encountered.
fields.summary: Warn users about apparent instability in the calendar plugin

fields.description: As reported at CONF-9559 the {{spaces/openuserpicker.action}} and {{spaces/grouppicker.action}} display unescaped content that can be entered in the url.  This forms an XSS vulnerability.

fields.description:
Having a page with the title "Multimedia" (for example).
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page with the following markup (in Wiki Markup mode):
{noformat}
[{include:Multimedia}|Multimedia]
{noformat}
# Save the page
# The page rendered as expected with the link to the page, "Multimedia"
# Edit the page again
# Switch to the "Rich Text" editor and back to "Wiki Markup" mode
# The wiki content now shows:
{noformat}
[{include:Multimedia}]

[]

\|Multimedia">
{include:Multimedia}
{noformat}

fields.description:
By default we ship Confluence to use a maximum of 15 database connections at any one time. This is one of the first things customers have to tweak when the reach any sort of request load on their application. We should look at raising this maximum to say 30 or 40 and consider also keeping some connections open permanently to make request processing after and idle period a little more responsive. 

It would be great if we could detect periods where requests seem to be backing up due to connection pool exhaustion and print appropriate alerts somewhere at the very least.
fields.summary: Increase default database connection pool size from 15 to 30

fields.description:
When our crowd server is offline confluence reports to the users when they try to login that their password is incorrect.
This can be very confusing because users are not aware that changing their password or calling the helpdesk for a new password won't correct the problem.

Please change the message to something in the order of:

- cannot authenticate
- crowd is offline
- lost connection to single signon server

etc.
fields.summary: When crowd is offline confluence should not tell the user it's password is incorrect.

fields.description:
If you create two users with differing usernames but identical 'full name' values then only one of them will be displayed on the people directory.

The problem is in the PeopleDirectoryAction$Person class.
These Person objects are stored in a TreeSet and their compareTo method uses fullname for comparison, which for a set means only one of the Person will be retained.

I guess the comparison should probably be done on the username.

This is raised from the hosted support case CHSP-1118.
fields.summary: If multiple users have the same full name only one of them will be shown in the people directory

fields.summary: Menus don't drop down in 2.8-m7-r2 in IE 7

fields.description:
If the HTTP proxy supports multiple authentication methods, the second one doesn't seem to work properly. For example, if the proxy responds with these headers:

{code}
HTTP/1.0 407 Proxy Authentication Required
Date: Fri, 14 Mar 2008 00:28:18 GMT
Content-Length: 938
Content-Type: text/html
Server: NetCache appliance (NetApp/5.6.2D12)
Proxy-Authenticate: NTLM
Proxy-Authenticate: Basic realm="Enter your ID and PASSWORD"
{code}

Confluence attempts the NTLM first (with the patch from CONF-2326), followed by the Basic authentication once the NTLM fails. But this doesn't seem to work for this particular proxy.

This occurs with the normal configuration of a HTTP proxy in Confluence with the following system properties:

{code}
-Dhttp.proxyHost=proxy.example.org  -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080 -Dhttp.proxyUser=userid -Dhttp.proxyPassword=password {code}

This bug affects the RSS macro and any other outbound HTTP connections.

Apache's HttpClient doc: http://hc.apache.org/httpclient-3.x/authentication.html#Proxy_Authentication
fields.summary: Confluence does not correctly handle outbound HTTP proxies with multiple authentication methods

fields.description:
The 'Add LDAP Integration' and child pages are poorly structures to in trying to integrate with a single generic repository, multiple repositories and Active Directory LDAP. It would be preferable to have a single, printable page for each of these paths that covers every single task in order. 

- Split the process into sections on a single page
- The troubleshooting sections and common gotchas should be referenced where needed rather than at the bottom of the parent document
- Add a TOC
- Start with a preparation section that checks the all criteria that Confluence and the LDAP server must meet
- Make this guide printable
- Consider a running example
fields.summary: Restructure LDAP documentation to a single page for each integration path

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10953].
  {panel}

It may be of interest to some of the customers to replace Multicast with {{"Well known Addresses"}} using Unicast. 

It could assist in bypassing known problems caused by using multicast and smart 'Cisco' switches, for example. Also some companies policy may not allow or support multicasting in their departments.

[Cluster Troubleshooting page|
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Cluster+Troubleshooting] suggests that some customers are using [WKA|http://wiki.tangosol.com/display/COH32UG/well-known-addresses] instead of Multicast. The page in question:

The Tangosol docs suggesting to place the specified changes in confluence_home/tangosol-coherence-override.xml

{code}
<unicast-listener>
    <!--
    Note: Specifying one or more "well known" addresses (WKA) will disable
    all multicast communication. In this case, for a member to join the cluster
    it will either have to be a WKA or there will have to be at least one WKA
    member running.
    Note: The "localhost" setting may not work on systems that define
    localhost as the loopback address; in that case, specify the machine
    name or the specific IP address.
    -->
    <well-known-addresses>
      <socket-address id='1'>
        <address/>
        <port>8088</port>
      </socket-address>
    </well-known-addresses>
    <address>localhost</address>
    <port>8088</port>
    <port-auto-adjust>true</port-auto-adjust>
    <packet-buffer>
      <maximum-packets>1428</maximum-packets>
    </packet-buffer>
    <priority>8</priority>
  </unicast-listener>
{code}
fields.summary: Support unicast addressing in cluster when well-known-addresses WKA are defined

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page.
# Highlight some text in the wiki markup editor
# Click the "insert link" icon
# In the pop-up, click on the "history" tab

Expected outcome:

* The alias text you highlighted is still in the pop-up form

Actual outcome

* Your alias is no more.

The last bug I filed on this (linked) was closed as a duplicate, but it's still not fixed on c.a.c or extranet, and it's probably the most annoying part of the editing experience for me right now because I get links out of my history far more often than I get them from search.

fields.description:
When viewing a mail in the Mail Archive that is part of a thread, the 'Entire Thread ( Show x of y )' link after the content of the mail is malformed. The link around the mail_thread_16.gif image next to the 'Entire Thread ( Show x of y )' is also malformed. The following is the HTML source generated:
Entire Thread (Showing 2 of 2)

As you can see, the first HREF is generated without a front quotation mark after the href=. The second HREF is generated but the $helper.key is not replaced properly. This results in bad links when following that page, as the links on the following now look like: http://www.example.com:8080/display/$helper.key/mail/425992 When trying those links, the following error is received: The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for. To replicate, go to the Mail Archive of a space, click on any mail that is part of a thread and scroll to the bottom. Click on the 'Entire Thread ( Showing x of y )' link and try to click on any of the emails that are generated after. The mail account is currently setup with a POP3 account off the local server that Confluence is running on.
fields.summary: Mail Archiving 'Entire Thread' image and link improperly formed.

fields.description:
- Go to Confluence Admin
- Click on Plugin Repository in left menu to list repository
- Scroll down to "Dynamic Task List 2"
- Click "Install" link
- Link is broken. Fails with (see image attachment) error.
{noformat:tile=genericised error}
Error downloading:
http://confluence.developer.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/proxy-counter/x.y.z/n/https://maven.atlassian.com/public/x/y/z/a/z.jar
sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
{noformat}

- This issue also occurs if you click on the Dynamic Tasklist 2 link in the first column which directs you to the Dynamic Task List 2 page which lists the more recent versions of the macro as well as links to install them. The topmost link for version 2.2 of the macro also is broken (I believe in the same way). You can however, install the previous version of the macro (2.1.3) successfully. Although, strangely enough, if you do so, the version list will now tell you that you have both 2.1.3 and 2.2 installed.

- Return to plugin list. Dynamic Task List 2 is now listed as installed (v2.1.3):

Dynamic Tasklist 2 — Atlassian Software Systems, Pyt Ltd	Free	Installed	Upgrade | Uninstall		Configure
Installed Version: 2.1.3 - Stable
Latest Version: 2.2 - Stable
License: BSD
Plugin Flags: System Plugin, Bundled Plugin, Uninstallable, Deletable, Dynamically Loaded, Enabled by Default
Plugin Macros: {dynamictasklist}, {tasklist}

A wiki-based checklist for tasks with easy, ajax-driven task completion.

- Notice the Upgrade link is broken too.

- Probably all the same problem, the file may not be in the right place.

Enjoy!!!
fields.summary: Installing plugin via plugin-repository fails with "unable to find valid certification path to requested target"

fields.description:
In order to reproduce this bug you need to
1) Setup mod_rewrite to redirect browser from url1 to url of the portlet
2) Point jiraportlet macro to the url1
3) You will get "Could not download:" error, although it is possible to access it with browser

It looks like jiraportlet macro server side code doesn't follow http redirects (302) while trying to download portlet contents from jira instance.

P.S. We need redirects and mod_rewrite for http / https separation.

Thanks in advance,
Alex
fields.summary: jiraportlet macro doesn't follow http redirects while retrieving portlet content

fields.description:
The information outlined in the "Advanced Configuration" section is not updated. We only need {{com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultCaptchaManager}} class and {{com.atlassian.confluence.cache.jcaptcha.ConfluenceCachingCaptchaStore}} class in the applicationContext.xml file. Furthermore, the {{com.atlassian.confluence.security.ConfluenceCaptchaEngine}} class is not needed in the captcha configuration. This information will be helpful.

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Spam+Prevention+%28Captcha%29?focusedCommentId=135331855#comment-135331855
fields.summary: Improve the Spam Prevention(Captcha) documentation

fields.description:
A [customer with a custom ConfluenceAuthenticator|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-15903] (based on the [Soulwing CAS Authenticatory|http://www.soulwing.org/confluence-cas.jsp] is reporting that their method calls for getUser in the userAccessor class are returning null.

The result is odd, because the behaviour of the authenticator is to:

1. Check whether or not they exist in Confluence
2. Create the user account via userAcessor.addUser
3. Check the user account just created.

The user has been added, and saved in Confluence's database yet the subsequent call to check if the user exists returns a null. However, if the server is bounced, the getUser query is successful

What looked to be caused by not using the userAccessor.saveUser, but implementing this method did not resolve the issue.
After reviewing the customer's source code with Paul, we suspect this problem may be caused by a particular hibernate query failing to execute: 

{noformat}
    <query name="atluser.user_findAllUserNames"><![CDATA[
        select user.name
        from DefaultHibernateUser user
        order by user.name
 ]]></query>
{noformat}

Hibernate logs show null returned immediately after a user is added.
fields.summary: calling getUser via the userAccessor returns null

fields.description:
Confluence's Lucene cannot search for Chinese characters (both traditional and simplified) in PDF file.
The same characters can be indexed fine in Word DOC file.

It appears that Confluence PDF Extractor fails to extract the chinese characters (See picture). Alphabets can be searched without any problem.

fields.description: I can't find any documentation letting users know how to view their personal page history by clicking the 'History' link in their account, so we should mention this somewhere on CAC so that users searching for 'personal history', 'recent pages' 'page history' can find it.
fields.summary: Document 'history' link of recently visited pages

fields.description:
We should limit the field size for the search input field. This will prevent for instance, nasty Oracle JDBC errors because the field entry is too long for the table. 
The only other issue here is the formatting issues associated to a large string entered for a query; the vm template will render the page as extremely wide due to the extremely long search term.

Referencing similar issues from JIRA; [JRA-14085|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-14085] and [JRA-8293|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-8293] the work around for Oracle database is to set the column in question to use CLOBs.
fields.summary: Limit the field size in Search field

fields.description:
Labels with special characters (periods, @, etc) can be assigned to bookmarks (either when first adding a bookmark or when editing the bookmark) without Confluence throwing up an error like it does when you try to add them to a page or if you use the Label Edit link (tested in 2.7) .

However if you Browse Space > Labels the labels with a period in them are displayed but when you click on one of them it says "The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for." 

Special characters should not be allowed to be added to bookmarks until they are fully supported, esp. since there is no way currently to do a global rename of a label should a lot of bookmarks be added with labels containing special characters.
fields.summary: Bookmark labels can contain special characters
